other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed a multinodular solid mass, measuring 9.0 × 8.0 × 6.0 cm, well-demarcated, yellow-whitish, soft, and firm with multifocal necrosis and hemorrhage. The tumor consisted of poorly differentiated hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) (20%) and large- and small-cell-type neuroendocrine carcinoma (NEC) (80%) components. The tumor invaded the right anterior portal vein and microvessels. No lymph node metastasis was found.
Showed a new mass measuring 7.3 cm in the right adrenal gland.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After 6.5 months post-operation, the adrenal mass disappeared, but other recurred masses were noted on the posterior aspect of the right kidney and both lungs.
